actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to establish a standard for determining substantial evidence of a drug's effectiveness for purposes of revocation of an approval of a new drug application under section 505 or repeal of a certification of antibiotics under section 507.

summary.text: Establishes, under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, a standard for determining substantial evidence of a drug's effectiveness for purposes of revocation of an approval of a new drug application under such Act, or repeal of a certification of antibiotics under such Act. (Amends 21 U.S.C. 355)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to establish a standard for determining substantial evidence of a drug's effectiveness for purposes of revocation of an approval of a new drug application under section 505 or repeal of a certification of antibiotics under section 507.
